title: Sauteing
creator_contributor_role: KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.), production company
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Cookery
description: Episode of Series "Cooking at the Academy". Grasp the finer points of sauteing and apply this fundamental technique to an international array of foods. As well as instructions on basic knife skills, the proper oils, fats and pans for sauteing are explained. Learn how to deglaze a pan to release extra flavours and present dishes with creative flourishes. Use these tips to conjure up the savoury "Chicked Dijon", chutney-laced "Chicken Madras" and Califonian "Franciscan Snapper."
related_objects: Series; S01150; Cooking at the Academy; Active; 1991
